physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure controlled with medication; hypertension for 3 years.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was clearly acromegalic upon presentation, with GH levels of 10.70 ng/ml and IGF-I levels of 492 ng/ml at baseline. Mildly increased serum prolactin at 25.5 ng/ml and decreased testosterone at 78 ng/dl.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: 3 months after treatment, IGF-I levels decreased to 439 ng/ml; GH levels were noted to fluctuate during follow-up, with a significant decrease after TSS.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Elevated plasma norepinephrine at 847 pg/ml and urine normetanephrine at 3506 µg/24h initially.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient had a 3.5 x 4.3 cm pituitary mass noted on MRI, which invaded the right cavernous sinus and compressed the optic chiasm.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Ten months after adrenalectomy, plasma normetanephrine was measured at 2396 pg/ml; these levels decreased to 465 pg/ml 3 months after TSS, and urine normetanephrine dropped to 727 µg/24h.
